page.title: 17The Battle of Sedgemoor
page.content: 1985 saw the Tercentenary of the Monmouth Rebellion and the Battle of Sedgemoor which was the last battle to be fought on English soil. The battle took place very close to Middlezoy and so the village and the village school were very involved in many of the events held to commemorate the battle. All the children at Middlezoy School, and many adults, dressed in 17th Century-style costumes. The children joined with children from other neighbouring schools for a day of activities which included a night camp and midnight walk to the actual battle site, dancing 17th century folk dances and a re-enactment of the battle on the school playing field at Westonzoyland. The Sealed Knot, an organisation which specialises in such activities, also re-enacted the battle and held a mock trial and execution.
